page.title: 14The Corner Shop
page.content: Mrs Fenwick's corner shop in Sugley Street is about 100 years old.It sells bread;confectionery;pop;washing up liquid and many other useful items such as needles,thread,shoelaces, and dummies.She gets her bread from Mother's Pride Bakery in Westerhope and other supplies from Wellworth Cash and Carry in Newburn.The shop opens at 8.45a.m.and closes at 7.00 p.m.on light summer nights.It is open seven days a week.Mrs Fenwick knows most customers by their Christian names and often chats to them about their problems and their families. Her busiest time is lunchtime when people buy pies and savoury sandwiches.She has a microwave oven to heat up pies.She even makes fresh sandwiches while you wait.Sunday is her busiest day,as people buy things they have forgotten during the week.
